means: 宣判…无罪( acquit的过去式和过去分词 )

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...月17日 (三) 04:42 (UTC)==首页新闻动态关==* 陈水扁是被当庭保释（on bail），不是「当庭释放」（acquitted），希望管理员尽快修正有关讹误。—User:Clithering|Clithering（User_talk:Cl.
2011年7月18日 -  acquittal 无罪释放;裁定无罪;省释 acquitted 获裁定无罪 act 行为;作为;法令 act in a disorderly manner 行为不检;扰乱秩序 act in a.
He has been acquitted and no wonder ., 他被判无罪 , 不足为奇.
He acquitted himself well of his task ., 他在好好地履行着自己的职责.

list.abs: Be kept in prison for life终身入狱Be acquitted 宣告无罪，脱卸义务和责任，还清债务Calamity 灾难，不幸事件
I acquit Edward of all essential misconduct ., 我原谅爱德华的所有根本过错.
In a highly controversial verdict , the jury acquitted Simpson ., 陪审团最后对辛普森做出了极具争议的无罪判决.
i thought that he acquitted himself admirably in the meeting ., 我认为他在会议上表现得非常出色.

entry.def: If someone is acquitted of a crime in a court of law, they are formally declared not to have committed the crime.

example.ex: Mr Ling was acquitted of disorderly behaviour by magistrates.
example.tran: 地方法官宣判林先生扰乱治安罪名不成立。

entry.def: If you acquit yourself well or admirably in a particular situation, other people feel that you have behaved well or admirably.

example.ex: Most officers and men acquitted themselves well throughout the action.
example.tran: 大多数军官及士兵在整个战斗中表现出色。

means.word_mean: 1. declared not guilty of a specific offense or crime; legally blameless;

sentences.sentence: "the jury found him not guilty by reason of insanity"
